final_answer.precision_note: Bond energies are given as integers; report ΔH to the nearest kJ mol-1 (3 s.f.).

method: Use ΔH = Σ(bonds broken) − Σ(bonds formed). For CH4 + 2O2 → CO2 + 2H2O: bonds broken are 4×(C–H) in CH4 and 2×(O=O) in 2O2. So broken = 4×413 + 2×498 = 1652 + 996 = 2648 kJ mol-1. Bonds formed are 2×(C=O) in CO2 and 4×(O–H) in 2H2O (each H2O has two O–H bonds). So formed = 2×805 + 4×463 = 1610 + 1852 = 3462 kJ mol-1. Therefore ΔH = 2648 − 3462 = −814 kJ mol-1 (exothermic).
checks: Combustion reactions are expected to be exothermic, so a negative ΔH is sensible.
Counting bonds: 4 C–H and 2 O=O broken; 2 C=O and 4 O–H formed matches the balanced equation.
